results.title: The Great treasure house
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Mans China”.
Covers the theme of medicine in China. Shows traditional medicine, including acupuncture and herbalism. Since the Cultural Revolution many remarkable new applications for the ancient art of acupuncture have been discovered, and some of these are shown. We also see ‘barefoot doctors’, trained in simple medicine, working in minor illnesses in small villages. With the help of modern techniques being developed, alongside ancient and traditional medicine, the Chinese are among the healthiest people in the world today.

results.title: The People's communes (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Felix Greene and Felix Greene Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Mans China”.
Uses scenes from three communes in different parts of China to show the range of work and activities carried on in communes. However, a clear picture of people’s rules within these communes and the structural organisation is not shown.

results.title: The People's army
results.creator_credit: Felix Greene and Felix Greene Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Mans China”.
An inside picture of the Chinese People’s Liberation Army - as well as being a fighting force, the army, in contrast to western peacetime armies, uses its personnel in “civilian” activities and is a training ground for politics, engineering and agriculture. Photographed, written and narrated by Felix Greene.

results.title: Eight or nine in the morning
results.creator_credit: Felix Greene and Felix Greene Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Mans China”.
An insight into China’s new educational ideas - old traditions have been abandoned, and education today is non-competitive, with exams rarely given. Looks at the status of intellectuals and touches on background philosophy since the revolution. Suitable for secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Self reliance
results.creator_credit: Felix Greene, World Entertainers and Felix Greene Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Mans China”

Covers the idea of China becoming self reliant in almost every aspect, including food, conservation of resources and industry at village levels. Shows the life style of industrial workers, housing developments, committees and neighbourhood workshops for housewives.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Felix Greene, World Entertainers and Felix Greene Films

results.title: Walter Spiel
results.creator_credit: James Fitzpatrick and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
A study of the 62 year old news vendor who sells American and foreign newspapers and magazines at his stand on a Los Angeles street corner. The camera establishes the relationship between “Willy” and his consumers as they come to his stand and look through their choices before purchase.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Fitzpatrick and United States Information Agency

results.title: Reverend Leon Sullivan
results.creator_credit: Harold Mayer and United States Information Agency
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “One Man”.
Through his inspired leadership, the Rev. Sullivan has been able to redeem and transform thousands of school dropouts and potential criminals. Describes the Opportunities Industrialisation Centre which he organised in order to train people of the ghetto to become skilled workers. Narrated by Barry Sullivan.
